content: The video is a review of the Roland RP 107, an entry-level digital piano with premium features. The reviewer discusses the piano's speaker detail, action, and supernatural piano sound, which is similar to the Roland GP3 digital grand piano. They also compare the RP 107 to other entry-level digital pianos on the market, such as the Kawai KDP 75 and the Yamaha Arius YDP 145. The RP 107 has a PHA-4 action, which is similar to professional-grade actions and has a triple sensor and escapement or let-off. The speaker performance is also discussed, with the RP 107 having a unique design that provides detailed sound through front toe ports. The piano comes with a stand, triple pedal, and bench and has a simple interface with 15 tones available. It also has Bluetooth midi and audio and can connect to the Roland Piano app for lesson programming and access to over 300 songs. Overall, the reviewer concludes that the RP 107 offers a great piano experience with a slightly different tone than other brands in its price range.
